intro: Tolumnia prionochila, commonly known as the red-tipped pineapple. It is a flowering plant native to Central and South America, belonging to the Bromeliaceae family. The plant is characterized by its rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves that form a central cup, which collects water. Its inflorescence consists of a cluster of small, white flowers surrounded by red bracts, giving it its common name. Tolumnia prionochila is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
